utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: I have been fantasizing about this for months.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Forget it. We're not here to fool around.

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: I'm not fooling around. I need this.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: You're an idiot. You know that?

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: Just shut up and give me a boost.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Hurry your ass up.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Hey, sometimes a guy's got to do what a guy's got to do. Jaguar one to control. Uh, sorry for the delay. Glenn had to take a leak. It was unavoidable. Target area is clear. Repeat: Target area confirmed clear.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Dr. Lee, target area is cleared. Launch vehicle's in range. All systems go.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Thank you, Cesar. Whenever you're ready. The CT-10's light enough to launch from a UAV, but can penetrate 8 feet of 6,000-psi concrete before detonation.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Bomb's away.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Precision guidance system's not affected by darkness or weather and can hit a 2-foot-wide target from 69,000 feet.

utterance.speaker: General
utterance.content: What about sound?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: None inbound at all. We've developed a new fan and a baffling design that—

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Ordnance on target in three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: I feel better already.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: You need to see a shrink. Seriously.

utterance.speaker: General
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Wendy! Call 911!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Karma's a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think her seizures are the result of bad karma?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think if you spend your days designing ever more effective ways to blow people up, stuff's bound to come back to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirsty. Side effect of a new antihistamine I'm on.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You don't seem congested.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm, intriguing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have any thoughts about our patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got some questions about whether Thirteen really believes in karma or just wants to. As for the patient, it's not gonna be easy to break into her office. Might want to start with her home.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We could ask to look through her office and we could do an MRI first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you're not interested in the case, why'd you take it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am definitely interested. Could be a tumor. Could be a CNS bleed. What do you do when you got two interesting puzzles?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Two?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: 50 bucks! Pay up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Let's go. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bet's off. Fight was fixed. That punch barely touched him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You bet on Foley to beat Zachary?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Speed beats power… unless speed has been paid to speedily take a dive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He touched him enough to put him on the canvas and the official counted him out, which means you officially owe me… 50 bucks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We bet on a sporting event. That was not sporting. Less than 30 seconds. That was barely even event-y.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay, here's what I saw. You lost and I won.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you can take that to your grave. You're not taking my 50 bucks.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Prove it. Prove it or pay up. You got one day. And don't make me send my boys out looking for you. What? All right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, two puzzles. Tie goes to the one that costs me money. Keep each other posted.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I've always been healthy. I never even get colds.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I guess your luck finally ran out.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I take it she doesn't like people who makes bombs.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: It's all right. Half of my family feels the same way. Of course they all work on Wall Street, so… Ever since the first 4th of July I can remember, I've always loved explosions. When I got to college and I had to pick a major, figured I might as well pick something I'm passionate about.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Destroying things. You weren't passionate about anything else?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Bombs are tools, just like anything else. You can use it to make things better or you can use it to make things worse. I also like romantic poetry and picnics. Is there anything else you want to know before we do this MRI?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope. Try to stay as still as possible. This shouldn't take long.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, how's it going?

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: You mind? I mean, there are plenty of other seats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not here to judge. You did what was best for you and I got no problem with that.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: I'm not gonna ask you nice again. Just go away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or what? You're suddenly gonna fall down? Listen. I got a problem. A guy who knows absolutely nothing about boxing, because of you now thinks he does. You can imagine the potential ramifications. I need you to get on the phone with him and tell him you took a dive.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: I didn't take a dive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take a picture of you to prove that it was really you and we're done. Just enough to convince him. Not enough to get you in any trouble.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: I didn't take a dive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. That story's getting boring. Look, I'm not from the commission. I'm not some bookie. I'm a doctor. This is my I.D.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Look, if you were a bookie, you'd know no one pays a guy to throw a fight he has no chance to win. I was a 12-to-1 underdog. Lost my last five fights.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you were the better fighter. That last punch barely touched you.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: You ever been barely touched by a guy who weighs 230 pounds? Look at me. Look where I am, what I'm wearing. Now, do I look like a guy who just got a payday? I didn't throw the fight. I just suck.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ha! Proof.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Just because he wasn't hit in the face—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look at his pupils. He has anisocoria, which, given his age, the adrenaline surge of the fight, the fact that he's still alive means he was tachycardic. He has Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The bet was on who would win, not who would live the longest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he's physically unable to continue because of a preexisting illness, then it's technically a "no contest," which means all bets are off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know that just because I was right about this one fighter doesn't make you any less of a man?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, it would, if you were right.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then as I said earlier, prove it. And one possibly Photoshopped cell phone pic does not a diagnosis make.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me, Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Désolé, je ne parle pas anglais.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: I'm a co-worker of Wendy Lee's. I'm also her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. I'm a guy who doesn't care.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: She's your patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you thought I didn't know who Wendy Lee was? Yeah, makes sense. I'm not good at names. Did Dr. Fortune tell you that?

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Her last boyfriend was a real nut. He's basically stalking her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, this is what I don't care about. I don't care who cares about her. Used to care about her. Either one you falls down dead, you can drop me a note.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: I think I know what's wrong with her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You screwed up in the lab and accidentally spilled some bomb on her?

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: No. He really is crazy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Poisoned?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently our mad scientist is also a slutty scientist whose milkshakes got all the nerds in the yard fighting over her.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's a slut because she's dated two different guys at work?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. I thought we were still judging her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's not a slut and it's not poison. When we tested her blood and cerebral spinal fluid for toxic exposure, it was negative for every poison we could think of.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, that just leaves every poison we didn't think of. She works in a bomb factory.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So do a lot of other not-sick people.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The guy had any actual evidence she was poisoned, he would have gone to the police, not to us.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And if we had any evidence of what was wrong with her, you'd be showing us MRI results. I assume they were negative.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Couldn't hurt to start activated charcoal, see what happens.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know what else wouldn't hurt? This case is getting interesting. Let's add a little danger.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hmmm.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just because he has guns doesn't make him a murderer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Tell that to the bear.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look in the desk. See if he's got a diary or a journal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Something tells me he's not exactly a diary kind of guy. Maybe a manifesto.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just look. I'm gonna check out the rest of the place, see if he's got a computer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's Foreman. Yep?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You break in yet?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, we're in the abattoir now. Why?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can leave. I think Taub and I found what we're looking for.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Looks like she actually was being poisoned, but she's been doing it to herself.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I'm not an alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know. I know the whole label thing is so limiting. You're a person who happens to suffer from alcoholism.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: You broke into my house and now you're being a smartass?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: During your history, you said you didn't drink at all.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You just collect bottles.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes. I collect them for my friend. She uses them in her art projects.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you're ashamed of these art projects. The bottles were hidden.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: That's because my housekeeper keeps throwing them out. I-I've told her a dozen times not to but either she doesn't understand or she doesn't care.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why would she lie?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's the easy question. She needs a government security clearance for her job.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And what's the hard question?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If she's an alcoholic, why doesn't she have at least some partially full bottles in the house? I mean, why keep the empties? Why not just throw them away?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So she's probably telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So what do we do?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We start her on Valium for alcohol withdrawal. It's the best we've got right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One normal EKG does not a healthy person make.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Look, I told you I just suck.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you make me so sad. Don't talk like that.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Why do you care so much?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kill me for loving my patients. It's just what I do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, stop. Stop! Look, my–my leg hurts. Okay? Just talk to me for a moment. You don't have to be a loser.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever's wrong with you, it's real. Sick is good. Sick means it can get better. You cold get better. And I don't mean healthier. I mean… maybe you don't have to suck.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Figure out what's wrong with yourself. Leave me alone.

utterance.speaker: Hoffner
utterance.content: Abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: She said it felt like she was being stabbed.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Ah! Ah!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give her morphine, 5 milligrams IV.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is it a symptom of the underlying condition or a symptom of our treatment?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'll know soon. I stopped her treatment.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We should restart it. Acute pancreatitis from alcoholism would cause this kind of pain.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's stress related.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's in a lot of pain.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's under a lot of stress. She's got two guys fighting over her and she got done with the final test of a new bomb. Her guilt is killing her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: As far as you know, she likes being the center of attention and loves her job.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: As far as you know, she doesn't drink.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if it's a kidney infection? Acute pyelonephritis could kill her if we don't start her on IV antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Would kill her if it was pyelonephritis, but since her urine and CSF don't show signs of infection—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I paged House. What? We got nothing. Less than nothing since he's actually ignoring my pages, which means we have a sick patient and apparently a sick boss.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Tell him you admit he's right. Let's get him back to work.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If he's ignoring you, it's because he trusts you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, it's not.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, it's not, but he does.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks. I feel warm inside. Right now I'm debating which bad idea I should pretend is a good idea and force everybody to implement.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think this is good for him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Obsessing over a bet is good? And doing his actual job, treating actual patients, that's bad?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House only doing what House wants is the only way he can function. Since the breakup, he's been seeking out crazier and crazier things to do because they're crazy. This is — well, it's not crazy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, just irresponsible and possibly dangerous.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: By House standards, it's dull. This he's doing just because he's interested. I think House getting back to doing… stupid House stuff for stupid House reasons is the best thing that could happen to him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll go explain that to the patient.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's definitely not pancreatitis. Restarting the treatment obviously didn't help anything. I assume you tested for infections. And I assume that look means "yes, and I was wrong." You call for a psych consult? Wow. That's the same look I just got from Chase. So an hour ago, we had three theories we couldn't agree on. Now we've got no theories, but we're in agreement.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: CT and ultrasound showed inflammation in the renal capsule. Could be an obstructing calculus or a perinephric abscess.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Blood cultures came back negative. It's probably just a benign cyst.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, let's just dismiss an idea because it's probably nothing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Could be gas in the perinephric space, in which case, we should be prepping her for emergency surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What looks like Wolff-Parkinson-White but isn't?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Her EKG was normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So was his. That's why I said "looks like." As in similar to, but not the same.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You want us to help you get out of paying your bet while your actual patient lies in agony.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's the real bad guy here? The guy who doesn't care enough to help or the four guys who are not competent enough to help? He works out too much, gets pounded too much, and not in the romantic way. His pupils—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your patient? No. Plenty of time to save her life after we save my money.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Underlying neurological condition exacerbated by an acute UTI brought on by her sexual escapades.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Slut? Escapades? How do we treat? A scarlet "A"?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry. Acute UTI brought on by her healthy enjoyment of her womanhood. We start her on IV ampicillin and an aminoglycoside.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You ignore us all the time. You go on crazy joyrides all the time. But you answer pages, you sleep. I know I'm gonna regret doing this, but I'll ask anyway. Is there anything I can do to help?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Although…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great news! You have an underlying neurological condition, which together with your heart—

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: You said my heart was fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I also said I would get you your career back. But it doesn't seem to matter since you've so clearly been handed the golden spit bucket. Sympathetic overdrive. It's a medical term. So is "great news." Of course, if you prefer wallowing… All you need is a chin. And a heart, apparently. Then you can go back to being the guy who won 20 of his first 20 instead of the guy who lost 5 of his last 5. Although, technically, I count the last one as a "no contest."

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: And you save 50 bucks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a doctor. I don't tell a fat guy to lay off bacon for less than 300. This is about dignity for both of us. Give me your arm. Give me your arm.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't worry. It's just epinephrine.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Ep-is it dangerous?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the wrong hands, very. So… yeah, sort of. This will only take a few seconds. And… you are tachycardic.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Yo, are you psycho?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We combine the increased heart rate with chest trauma by applying a little sweet science to the science. Don't worry. I'll–I'll explain more when you wake up. Now, the punch that supposedly knocked you out looked like it was thrown by an old cripple. Kind of like this.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Look, stop it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three, two, one. Huh. Seem to be older and more crippled than I thought.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Look — no. You're embarrassing me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn't make sense. Maybe if I—

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Look, get the hell out of my life, you lunatic.

utterance.speaker: Gibbs
utterance.content: She's in V-tach. BP's dropping.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Whatever you're doing isn't working again. There's got to be some way to stop the seizures.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not a seizure. She's having a heart attack. No pulse.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: That's impossible! She runs marathons!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Charging to 200. Clear.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Still no pulse.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Charging to 300.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Why is this happening?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My theory is that he's only avoiding us because he really wants to avoid you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ma nishtana? You made it through med school without ever attending a Seder? It means "why is this night different from all other nights?"

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not sure it is. But usually when push comes to shove, he shows up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If the patient's still alive, then push hasn't met shove yet.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Patient is hanging by a thread and we don't have a clue why.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then we have to assume he does and she isn't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We could or we could assume that something is seriously wrong with House and try to do something about that. This way, even if we're wrong, nobody dies.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House is fine. House is always fine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm expanding my theory. He's avoiding you and you're avoiding him and this patient is gonna die.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not if you do your job.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How did you get in here?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My boss has me break into places all the time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pain has been getting worse. I figured if I upped the Vicodin any more, I'd end up back in a rubber room, so this seemed like the smarter choice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You drove all the way over here to break in and call me an idiot?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, I drove all the way over here to tell you we're implanting an automated cardio-defibrillator, which won't actually do anything to help the patient except maybe give us enough time to come up with a guess as to what's actually wrong with her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, that makes more sense.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And I broke in here because Cuddy and Wilson both separately asked me to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even more logical.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And that's not heroin, which means you knew I was coming over here, and Cuddy and Wilson are right. You're just playing a game. Throwing out a bone and watching us fight over it. {She starts to leave in a huff.]

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There is another theory. Compound CS-804. It's an experimental drug that's supposed to regrow muscle.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This experiment was done on rats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's groundbreaking. Huge success.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: In rats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, they got four legs. Think how fast it should work on one.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We've got a problem.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: AICD not working?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If it's the defibrillator, I'd be looking elsewhere. Smells like bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Rectal?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And vaginal.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Is it possible something got perforated during surgery?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is that an accusation?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sounded like a question. Just a straightforward inquiry that only someone with serious insecurities would take issue with.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay, so in answering, I have to decide between the only two possibilities. "No" and "yes, we might have screwed something up, but are intentionally hiding it because we're incompetent and we're asses." Answer is "no." Glad we didn't shortchange that avenue. It's a blood disorder. A coagulopathy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's not a diagnosis. That's like saying she has a runny nose.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: True, but not saying she has a runny nose risks getting snot all over us. We can treat it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cause could still be a toxin. She must have been exposed to who knows—

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Past tense, which means she would have been better now that she's not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Same goes for House. If this was about Cuddy, he would have checked out weeks ago. Something else is going on. Something new.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's an awfully simplistic approach to matters of the heart.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House is rational. He prides himself—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No one is rational about emotion. That's why they're emotions.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Me? I didn't say anything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You always have some opinion on these things, especially when it comes to House, double especially when it comes to men and romance, but suddenly you're keeping your mouth shut.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House can't help us. I respect his privacy, no matter how stupid and I'd appreciate it if you'd respect mine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to treat the underlying condition. Could be cancer, sepsis, trauma, liver disease, hemorrhagic fever—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm gonna start treating the symptoms while you finish listing the possible causes.

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: The rats are doing great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Great" is a little vague.

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: Even better than the previous study. 12% increase in strength, 22% in flexibility, and some improvement in at least 60% of the subjects.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you done maximum tolerated dose studies?

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: Not yet. But that's part of the beauty. Since the compound is easily excreted in urine, as long as they keep hydrated, there's really no reason to expect any danger at virtually any dose. I mean, obviously you can't know for sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But if it's worthy of the preface "obviously," then obviously it only needs to be explained to idiots. Do I look like an idiot? Sorry. Cranky. What I meant to say was: Why don't scientists have groupies? 'Cause I'd do you right now if society wasn't telling me that you're just an underpaid dork.

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Leg hurts. Would you mind getting me a coffee?

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: How does coffee help your leg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It will prevent me from walking to get the coffee.

utterance.speaker: Riggin
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Page said she's now bleeding from her mouth.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You start treatment?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I said I would.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A "yes" would have been fine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not asking the question would have been even better.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Any breathing issues?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No, but—

utterance.speaker: Gibbs
utterance.content: I'm not sure it's internal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If it's coming from both ends, it's internal.

utterance.speaker: Gibbs
utterance.content: Her gums look like they were burned.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Experimental drugs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's unfair. 'Cause at one point, even Vicodin was an experimental drug. I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, unless you're going to do your job, it can wait.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm going to do my job.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll give you a lift.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll give you two minutes. But first, I'm gonna tell you that I'm off the drugs and you'll feel silly 'cause you've got nothing to say for two minutes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm. Why are you off them?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because they don't work.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why were you on them?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because they come in banana flavor. You know the answer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think fixing your leg will fix your life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think that my life will be somewhat better if part of my life, specifically my leg, is somewhat better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think all your problems are your leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you're here to tell me that no matter how depressed I may be, it's not enough.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think you want everything to be physical, tangible, simple. You want unhappiness to have a cure. House, you obviously—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hate that word. I have to go now. Actually, I don't, but it would be rude to walk out without saying anything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about this? 28-year-old woman presenting with burn-like wounds in her mouth and esophagus from a candidiasis infection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Interesting. It would also be relevant if the woman had had seizures.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We would have seen it in the blood work.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Acute myeloid leukemia can cause swelling in the gums.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Again, interesting but not relevant.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Again, you're being an ass.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She doesn't have a history of blood diseases in her family, her blood count's normal, and she hasn't been exposed to chemical toxins.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not that we know of.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Guy that she works most closely with is also her boyfriend. You don't think he would have told us if there had been some sort of chemical spill or accident?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There is one other cause of AML.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Wait! Where are you taking her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to get her into an isolation room and prep for a hematopoietic stem cell transplant.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Isolation? Why?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We think her blood and immune system have been destroyed by an exposure to ionizing radiation.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: But we don't work with radiation.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Well, apparently your girlfriend does.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: No, she doesn't. You're wrong. It must be something else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We found reports that your company was developing tactical nuclear warheads for bunker-busting bombs.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: Where? On Wikipedia? Some paranoid idiot's blog? I don't care where you read it. It's not true.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're saying there's absolutely no chance that anyone in your company is doing any experimental research that you don't know about?

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: No, but I know Wendy and she wouldn't.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Well, maybe you don't know her as well as you thought you did.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Excuse me. We have to go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You need a drink.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That wasn't a question. You really do need a drink.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Found a match. We'll start treatment as soon as we get the HSC from the donor. Shouldn't be long.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Where's Cesar?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh, he's in the waiting room.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I want to see him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can't. It's too dangerous with your immune system this compromised.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Why can't he just put on a gown and a mask like you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sorry. The more people you're exposed to, the greater chance of infection.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I'm scared.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know. We're doing everything that we can.

utterance.speaker: Gibbs
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman, you should look at this.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You feeling any pain in your pelvic region?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No, why?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your genitals… they're engorged.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: I drink any more, I'm gonna explode.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not going to explode. You're just gonna have a seizure, which will prove that your kidneys are not working, which will also prove that they weren't working Saturday night. That's why a glancing body blow sent your blood pressure into the toilet and you onto the canvas.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: How many bottles is this supposed to take?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Six.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: And I've drank how many?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eight. It's not an exact science.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: So in other words, nothing's gonna prove you wrong. You're just gonna keep making me miserable because you're too miserable—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're an idiot. No, you're not gonna hit me… 'Cause somewhere deep in that way-too-thin skull of yours you know that you're full of crap. That's why you stopped jogging for me. That's why you drank eight bottles. Because even though you want to think that I'm wrong 'cause it's simpler, you also desperately want me to be right. I'm only an ass for building your hopes up if I'm wrong. Last one.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were wrong. It's not the end of the world.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anything else you want to say?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have a problem. I think if you seriously look at everything that—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay, look, this isn't— Okay! Okay! Okay! Okay! No… I don't. Just get out of here. Go home. We'll talk later. Someplace without any of my stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing to talk about. That was my point.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Inflammation of the genitals means we were wrong.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thanks for the statement of the obvious.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You'd think so, wouldn't you? Foreman wants to keep shooting for radiation poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because the seizure's have stopped. Because her fever's gone away. Because she's improved. By luck.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't think the patient cares.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, she's gonna die in considerably less discomfort thanks to you treating a few of the symptoms instead of the disease.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I paged Ho—

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: You're drunk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, whose fault is that? Give me another scotch.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: I can't serve you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This 'cause I'm black? 'Cause I'm not, so…

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: Come on, buddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look, you can't get me drunk and then give me crap for being drunk. That's like dumping someone and then giving them crap for being upset. That's just not decent. Let me explain why people come here. They come here to drink. Which causes us to ask, why do people drink? Hmm? Is it sustenance? No. Is it taste? No.

utterance.speaker: Fellow Patron
utterance.content: Don't be a jerk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is it the company of stout-hearted men? I don't think so. Is it killing pain? Yes. Seven and a half percent life duller. That's the business you're in. You're in the "screw the world" business. You're in the "reality sucks and fantasy temporarily appears to not suck" business.

utterance.speaker: Fellow Patron
utterance.content: Just get the moron a drink so he'll shut the hell up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: I'm giving you your drink.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you no pride? Either serving me is a good idea or it's a bad idea. Shutting me up is a crappy reason for compromising what you believe.

utterance.speaker: Fellow Patron
utterance.content: Not even an effective one apparently.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Am I gonna have to hit him?

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: Not a good idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But what if it's the right thing to do? Compromise is never the answer. Stand up. I will allow you to throw the first punch.

utterance.speaker: Fellow Patron
utterance.content: Sit down. I'm not gonna hit you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just as well, 'cause I was lying.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can relax.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: She's getting better?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bad news is, because of your extended exposure to her and her workplace, we're gonna need to treat you as well.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: I feel fine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Unfortunately that's the way it can be with radiation. No symptoms until it's too late to do anything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're gonna need a bone marrow transplant.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: A marrow transplant does leave you exposed to all sorts of illnesses, but there really is no choice here.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: She doesn't have radiation poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's getting better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We need to start your treatment before it's too late.

utterance.speaker: Cesar
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're either suicidal or you know we're wrong. And the only way you could know for sure what wasn't killing her is if you knew what was. And you do, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because you've been poisoning her and the reason she's getting better is because you haven't been near her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Our co-workers are on their way to your home right now to search for poisons. You mind saving them the trouble?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Attempted murder is better than murder.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Training for my big fight. Just need you to—

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Drink five more bottles? Get punched a few more times? Look, just get out and give up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's your specialty.

utterance.speaker: Foley
utterance.content: Ooh, looks like you already lost your big fight. Look, I may not be able to take a punch, but I can still throw one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three, two… What a lovely day.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Where's Cesar?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Um… in jail. He was trying to kill you. He found out about you and Glenn, which, he admitted, shouldn't have surprised him since he started seeing you while you were dating Tony.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: He poisoned me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Repeatedly… with Spanish fly. The active ingredient cantharidin is a potent toxin and can cause a lot of the same damage as radiation.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: He poisoned me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: He had a security clearance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ahem! What's this? A palm. Hmm, useful for many things. Slapping, greasing, probably some other applications too. Right now it's ready for $50 and humiliation.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He was actually sick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He wasn't knocked out by the punch. He was knocked out by the clinch before the punch. Took a shot to the back of the neck. More specifically, to an abnormal growth of nerves caused by a glomus tumor. Kind of like a built-in taser. Sent a massive shock to his entire body, shut everything down.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wow. Fascinating. Completely explains exactly how he lost.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you are not gonna be like that, 'cause you got a lot more posters here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, I'm not. Well done, House. You might have saved that guy. Given him his life back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, no. He needs surgery. He's never gonna fight again.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What happened to your eye? You okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better than okay.
